articles.title: Francouzsk√© flirtovac√≠ fr√°ze pro ƒåechy
articles.content:
Francie je zem√≠ l√°sky a francouz≈°tina je jazykem, kter√Ω jako by byl stvo≈ôen pro romantiku. Jej√≠ mƒõkk√° v√Ωslovnost a poetick√° slovn√≠ z√°soba z n√≠ ƒçin√≠ ide√°ln√≠ n√°stroj pro flirtov√°n√≠. Nauƒçte se tyto fr√°ze a okouzlete sv√©ho francouzsky mluv√≠c√≠ho partnera eleganc√≠ a ≈°armem.

## Elegantn√≠ lichotky

### "Tu es magnifique."
**V√Ωslovnost:** T√º e ma≈àifik.

**P≈ôeklad:** Jsi n√°dhern√Ω/√°.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** Silnƒõj≈°√≠ ne≈æ prost√© "beau/belle" (hezk√Ω/√°). Vyjad≈ôuje obdiv k celkov√©mu vzhledu a vyza≈ôov√°n√≠.

---

### "Tu as un sourire irr√©sistible."
**V√Ωslovnost:** T√º a √∂≈à surir irezizt√≠bl.

**P≈ôeklad:** M√°≈° neodolateln√Ω √∫smƒõv.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** Francouzi oce≈àuj√≠ specifick√© komplimenty. Zm√≠nka o √∫smƒõvu je v≈ædy v√≠t√°na.

---

### "Tu me plais beaucoup."
**V√Ωslovnost:** T√º m√∂ ple b√≥k√∫.

**P≈ôeklad:** Velmi se mi l√≠b√≠≈°.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** P≈ô√≠m√©, ale elegantn√≠ vyj√°d≈ôen√≠ z√°jmu. Perfektn√≠ pro ran√© f√°ze vztahu.

---

### "J'adore tes yeux."
**V√Ωslovnost:** ≈Ωador te zj√∂.

**P≈ôeklad:** Zbo≈æ≈àuji tv√© oƒçi.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** Klasick√° francouzsk√° lichotka. Oƒçi jsou ve francouzsk√© romantice velmi d≈Øle≈æit√©.

---

## Romantick√© fr√°ze

### "Je ne peux pas arr√™ter de penser √† toi."
**V√Ωslovnost:** ≈Ωe n√∂ p√∂ pa aret√© d√∂ pans√© a twa.

**P≈ôeklad:** Nem≈Ø≈æu p≈ôestat myslet na tebe.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** Sladk√° zpr√°va pro partnera, kter√° ukazuje, ≈æe v√°m nesch√°z√≠ z mysli.

---

### "Tu fais battre mon c≈ìur."
**V√Ωslovnost:** T√º fe batr mo≈à k√∂r.

**P≈ôeklad:** Rozechv√≠v√°≈° mi srdce.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** Poetick√© vyj√°d≈ôen√≠ p≈ôita≈ælivosti, typicky francouzsk√©.

---

### "Je suis fou/folle de toi."
**V√Ωslovnost:** ≈Ωe s√ºi f√∫/fol d√∂ twa.

**P≈ôeklad:** Jsem do tebe bl√°zen/bl√°zniv√°.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** V√°≈°niv√© prohl√°≈°en√≠. "Fou" ≈ô√≠k√° mu≈æ, "folle" ≈æena.

---

## Sv≈Ødn√© fr√°ze

### "Tu as quelque chose de sp√©cial."
**V√Ωslovnost:** T√º a kelk√∂ ≈°√≥z d√∂ spesjal.

**P≈ôeklad:** Je na tobƒõ nƒõco zvl√°≈°tn√≠ho.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** Tajemn√° lichotka, kter√° naznaƒçuje hlub≈°√≠ z√°jem ne≈æ jen fyzickou p≈ôita≈ælivost.

---

### "Je pourrais me perdre dans tes yeux."
**V√Ωslovnost:** ≈Ωe pur√© m√∂ perdr d√°n te zj√∂.

**P≈ôeklad:** Mohl/a bych se ztratit v tv√Ωch oƒç√≠ch.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** Romantick√° a poetick√° fr√°ze pro intimn√≠ momenty.

---

### "Tu me rends heureux/heureuse."
**V√Ωslovnost:** T√º m√∂ r√°n √∂r√∂/√∂r≈ëz.

**P≈ôeklad:** Dƒõl√°≈° mƒõ ≈°≈•astn√Ωm/ou.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** Up≈ô√≠mn√© vyj√°d≈ôen√≠ toho, jak pozitivnƒõ partner ovliv≈àuje v√°≈° ≈æivot.

---

## Fr√°ze pro zpr√°vy

### "Bonjour mon amour."
**V√Ωslovnost:** Bon≈æ√∫r mo≈à am√∫r.

**P≈ôeklad:** Dobr√Ω den, l√°sko.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** Klasick√Ω zp≈Øsob, jak pozdravit partnera. "Mon amour" je bƒõ≈æn√© osloven√≠ mezi milenci.

---

### "Tu me manques."
**V√Ωslovnost:** T√º m√∂ m√°nk.

**P≈ôeklad:** Chyb√≠≈° mi.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** Pozor na konstrukci ‚Äì doslova "ty mi chyb√≠≈°" (ty jsi podmƒõtem). Francouz≈°tina to vyjad≈ôuje opaƒçnƒõ ne≈æ ƒçe≈°tina.

---

### "J'ai h√¢te de te revoir."
**V√Ωslovnost:** ≈Ω√© √°t d√∂ t√∂ r√∂vwar.

**P≈ôeklad:** Nem≈Ø≈æu se doƒçkat, a≈æ tƒõ zase uvid√≠m.

**Kdy pou≈æ√≠t:** Po sch≈Øzce nebo bƒõhem obdob√≠ odlouƒçen√≠.

---

## Kulturn√≠ tipy pro flirtov√°n√≠ s Francouzi

**Subtilnost:** Francouzsk√© flirtov√°n√≠ je ƒçasto subtilnƒõj≈°√≠ ne≈æ v jin√Ωch kultur√°ch. M√©nƒõ je v√≠ce.

**Intelekt:** Francouzi oce≈àuj√≠ inteligentn√≠ konverzaci. Vtip a duchaplnost jsou sexy.

**Tempo:** Francouzsk√© randƒõn√≠ je pomalej≈°√≠. U≈æijte si proces sv√°dƒõn√≠.

**M√≥da:** Francouzi si v≈°√≠maj√≠ stylu. Elegantn√≠ obleƒçen√≠ je souƒç√°st√≠ flirtu.

**"Je t'aime" vs "Je t'adore":** "Je t'aime" je velmi siln√© a ≈ô√≠k√° se pouze ve v√°≈æn√©m vztahu. "Je t'adore" je bezpeƒçnƒõj≈°√≠ volba v ran√© f√°zi.

S tƒõmito fr√°zemi budete schopni okouzlit sv√©ho francouzsky mluv√≠c√≠ho partnera s eleganc√≠ hodnou Pa≈ô√≠≈æe.

articles.title: Macarca Tartƒ±≈üma ve Anla≈ümazlƒ±k ƒ∞fadeleri
articles.content:
Macarca konu≈üan bir partnerinizle saƒülƒ±klƒ± tartƒ±≈ümalar i√ßin doƒüru ifadeleri bilmek √∂nemlidir. ƒ∞≈üte temel Macarca tartƒ±≈üma ifadeleri.

## Temel Tartƒ±≈üma ƒ∞fadeleri

### 1. "B√°ntottnak √©rzem magam, amikor..."
**Telaffuz:** *Bantotnak erzem magam, amikor...*

**Anlam:** "...olduƒüunda incinmi≈ü hissediyorum"

**√ñrnek:** "B√°ntottnak √©rzem magam, amikor nem figyelsz r√°m." (Bana dikkat etmediƒüinde incinmi≈ü hissediyorum.)

### 2. "Besz√©lhet√ºnk err≈ël nyugodtan?"
**Telaffuz:** *Beselhetunk err√∂l nyugodtan?*

**Anlam:** "Bu konuyu sakin bir ≈üekilde konu≈üabilir miyiz?"

### 3. "Meg√©rtem a n√©z≈ëpontodat, de..."
**Telaffuz:** *Megertem a nez√∂pontodat, de...*

**Anlam:** "Senin bakƒ±≈ü a√ßƒ±nƒ± anlƒ±yorum, ama..."

### 4. "Ne kiab√°ljunk"
**Telaffuz:** *Ne kiyabalyunk*

**Anlam:** "Baƒüƒ±rmayalƒ±m"

### 5. "Nem ezt akartam mondani"
**Telaffuz:** *Nem est akartam mondani*

**Anlam:** "Bunu kastetmedim"

### 6. "Sz√ºks√©gem van egy kis id≈ëre egyed√ºl"
**Telaffuz:** *Suk≈üegem van edy ki≈ü id√∂re edyedul*

**Anlam:** "Yalnƒ±z biraz zamana ihtiyacƒ±m var"

### 7. "Keress√ºnk kompromisszumot"
**Telaffuz:** *Kere≈ü≈üunk kompromissumot*

**Anlam:** "Bir uzla≈üma bulalƒ±m"

### 8. "Nem akartalak megb√°ntani"
**Telaffuz:** *Nem akartalak megbantani*

**Anlam:** "Seni incitmek istemedim"

### 9. "Elmondan√°d, hogyan √©rzel?"
**Telaffuz:** *Elmondanad, hodyan erzel?*

**Anlam:** "Nasƒ±l hissettiƒüini anlatƒ±r mƒ±sƒ±n?"

### 10. "Azt hiszem, mindkett≈ënknek le kell nyugodnia"
**Telaffuz:** *Ast hisem, mindkett√∂nknek le kel nyugodnia*

**Anlam:** "Sanƒ±rƒ±m ikimizin de sakinle≈ümesi gerekiyor"

### 11. "Szeretlek, de d√ºh√∂s vagyok"
**Telaffuz:** *Seretlek, de duh√∂≈ü vadyok*

**Anlam:** "Seni seviyorum, ama kƒ±zgƒ±nƒ±m"

### 12. "Besz√©lj√ºnk err≈ël k√©s≈ëbb"
**Telaffuz:** *Besselyunk err√∂l ke≈ü√∂bb*

**Anlam:** "Bunu daha sonra konu≈üalƒ±m"

## Macar K√ºlt√ºr√ºnde Tartƒ±≈üma

Macarlar d√ºr√ºst ileti≈üimi deƒüerlendirir. "Bocs√°nat" (√∂z√ºr dilerim) ve "K√©rem" (l√ºtfen) √∂nemli kelimelerdir.

"√âdesem" veya "Dr√°g√°m" (sevgilim) hitabƒ± tartƒ±≈ümayƒ± yumu≈üatabilir.

Bu ifadelerle Macarca konu≈üan partnerinizle yapƒ±cƒ± diyaloglar kurabilirsiniz.

articles.title: Is Italian Hard? Honest Assessment
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Dreaming of whispering sweet **amore** (love) in your partner's ear while strolling through Rome? Or perhaps ordering **pasta** (pasta) together at an authentic Italian trattoria? Many English-speaking couples wonder: is Italian really hard to learn? The beautiful truth is that Italian is one of the most romantic and accessible languages for English speakers to master together.

## The Good News: Italian is Actually Easier Than You Think

According to the Foreign Service Institute (FSI), Italian is classified as a Category I language for English speakers, meaning it's one of the easiest languages to learn. Here's why Italian might be your perfect romantic adventure:

### 1. Familiar Vocabulary

English has borrowed thousands of words from Italian, especially in music, art, and cuisine. You already know more Italian than you realize!

<VocabCard
  word="piano"
  translation="soft/quiet (also the musical instrument)"
  pronunciation="[pee-AH-no]"
  example="Suona il piano molto bene."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="bravo"
  translation="good/well done"
  pronunciation="[BRAH-vo]"
  example="Bravo! Hai cucinato benissimo!"
/>

### 2. Phonetic Pronunciation

Unlike English, Italian pronunciation is incredibly consistent. Once you learn the rules, you can pronounce any Italian word correctly just by reading it.

| Italian Letter | Sound | Example |
|----------------|-------|----------|
| a | ah | **casa** [KAH-sa] (house) |
| e | eh | **bene** [BEH-neh] (well) |
| i | ee | **vino** [VEE-no] (wine) |
| o | oh | **amore** [ah-MOH-reh] (love) |
| u | oo | **luna** [LOO-na] (moon) |

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Ti amo"
  translation="I love you"
  pronunciation="[tee AH-mo]"
  context="The most romantic phrase to practice together"
/>

## The Challenges: What Makes Italian Tricky

While Italian is relatively easy, there are some aspects that require practice:

### 1. Verb Conjugations

Italian verbs change their endings based on who's doing the action. But don't worry ‚Äì starting with regular verbs makes this manageable:

<ConjugationTable
  verb="amare"
  meaning="to love"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "I", word: "amo", translation: "I love" },
    { person: "You", word: "ami", translation: "you love" },
    { person: "He/She", word: "ama", translation: "he/she loves" },
    { person: "We", word: "amiamo", translation: "we love" },
    { person: "You (plural)", word: "amate", translation: "you all love" },
    { person: "They", word: "amano", translation: "they love" }
  ]}
/>

### 2. Gendered Nouns

Every Italian noun is either masculine or feminine, which affects the articles and adjectives used with them:

<VocabCard
  word="il ragazzo"
  translation="the boy (masculine)"
  pronunciation="[eel ra-GAH-tso]"
  example="Il ragazzo √® molto gentile."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="la ragazza"
  translation="the girl (feminine)"
  pronunciation="[la ra-GAH-tsa]"
  example="La ragazza √® molto bella."
/>

## Fun Activities for Couples Learning Italian

### 1. Romantic Date Nights in Italian

Practice ordering dinner entirely in Italian. Start with these essential phrases:

- **Vorremmo un tavolo per due** [vor-REHM-mo oon TAH-vo-lo per DOO-eh] - "We would like a table for two"
- **Il conto, per favore** [eel KON-to per fa-VOH-reh] - "The bill, please"

### 2. Morning Coffee Conversations

Replace your morning English chat with simple Italian phrases:

<VocabCard
  word="Buongiorno, amore"
  translation="Good morning, love"
  pronunciation="[bwon-JOR-no ah-MOH-reh]"
  example="Buongiorno, amore! Hai dormito bene?"
/>

### 3. Cooking Italian Together

Learn recipe vocabulary while preparing authentic Italian meals:

| Cooking Term | Italian | Pronunciation |
|--------------|---------|---------------|
| To cook | **cucinare** | [koo-chee-NAH-reh] |
| Salt | **sale** | [SAH-leh] |
| Pepper | **pepe** | [PEH-peh] |
| Delicious | **delizioso** | [deh-lee-tsee-OH-so] |

<CultureTip title="Italian Meal Times" flag="üáÆüáπ">
Italians eat dinner much later than Americans ‚Äì typically between 8-10 PM. Use this cultural knowledge to practice time expressions: "Ceniamo alle otto" (We dine at eight).
</CultureTip>

## Timeline: How Long Does It Take?

The FSI estimates 600-750 class hours to reach proficiency in Italian. For couples studying together:

- **3 months**: Basic conversations about daily life
- **6 months**: Comfortable with present tense, simple past
- **1 year**: Intermediate conversations, travel confidently in Italy
- **2 years**: Advanced discussions, understanding Italian films

<VocabCard
  word="insieme"
  translation="together"
  pronunciation="[een-see-EH-meh]"
  example="Studiamo l'italiano insieme."
/>

## Making Italian Easier: Proven Strategies for Couples

### 1. Create Italian-Only Hours

Dedicate specific times when you only speak Italian with each other. Start with 15 minutes daily.

### 2. Watch Italian Content Together

Begin with Italian movies with subtitles, then progress to Italian shows. Netflix has excellent Italian content like "Suburra" or "Baby."

### 3. Use Technology

Apps like Duolingo, Babbel, or Busuu offer couple challenges and progress tracking.

<CultureTip title="Gestures Matter" flag="üáÆüáπ">
Italians are famous for speaking with their hands. Learning common gestures like the "finger purse" (fingertips together, moving up and down) for "What do you want?" adds authenticity to your Italian conversations.
</CultureTip>

## Common Mistakes to Avoid

1. **Don't over-focus on grammar initially** ‚Äì Start with practical phrases
2. **Don't be afraid of making mistakes** ‚Äì Italians appreciate effort
3. **Don't neglect listening practice** ‚Äì Italian music and podcasts are invaluable
4. **Don't forget regional variations** ‚Äì Standard Italian is understood everywhere

## The Romantic Advantage

Learning Italian as a couple provides unique benefits:

- **Built-in practice partner** available 24/7
- **Shared goal** strengthens your relationship
- **Cultural experiences** to enjoy together
- **Travel preparation** for your Italian adventures

<VocabCard
  word="dolce met√†"
  translation="sweet half (soulmate)"
  pronunciation="[DOL-cheh meh-TAH]"
  example="Sei la mia dolce met√†."
/>

## Your Italian Journey Starts Now

Is Italian hard to learn? For motivated English-speaking couples, absolutely not. With its logical pronunciation, familiar vocabulary, and romantic appeal, Italian offers the perfect blend of accessibility and passion. The key is consistency, patience, and enjoying the journey **insieme** (together).

Remember: every expert was once a beginner. Start with simple phrases, celebrate small victories, and before you know it, you'll be planning your Italian honeymoon in fluent italiano!

<CTA text="Ready to master Italian together?" buttonText="Start Learning Now" />

sections: ## Fun Activities for Couples Learning Italian
## Making Italian Easier: Proven Strategies for Couples

articles.title: Godmorgen og Godnat p√• Polsk: S√∏de Fraser til Din Partner
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

De f√∏rste og sidste ord p√• dagen er magiske. En s√∏d godmorgen p√• polsk kan starte dagen perfekt, og en k√¶rlig godnat sikrer s√∏de dr√∏mme. Kombiner med vores [polske k√¶lenavne](/learn/da/pl/polish-pet-names-and-endearments/)!

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Good morning, my love"
  translation="Godmorgen, min elskede"
  pronunciation="gud mor-ning mai lav"
  context="Start dagen med k√¶rlighed"
/>

## Godmorgen Fraser

<VocabCard
  word="Good morning"
  translation="Godmorgen"
  pronunciation="gud mor-ning"
  example="Good morning, sweetheart!"
/>

| Polsk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **Good morning** | Godmorgen | gud mor-ning |
| **Good morning, my love** | Godmorgen, min elskede | gud mor-ning mai lav |
| **Did you sleep well?** | Har du sovet godt? | did juu sliip wel? |
| **What a beautiful morning** | Sikke en smuk morgen | wot uh byu-ti-ful mor-ning |
| **Rise and shine!** | Op og hoppe! | raiz and shain! |

### S√∏de Morgenhilsner

- **Did you dream of me?** (Har du dr√∏mt om mig?) - "did juu driim ov mi?"
- **You're my first thought** (Du er min f√∏rste tanke) - "joor mai furst thot"
- **Coffee, darling?** (Kaffe, skat?) - "ko-fi, dar-ling?"
- **Good morning, sunshine** (Godmorgen, solskin) - "gud mor-ning, sun-shain"

<CultureTip flag="üáµüá±" title="Morgenkultur">
Engl√¶ndere starter ofte dagen med 'a cuppa' - perfekt tidspunkt for en k√¶rlig besked.
</CultureTip>

## Morgenmotivation

- **Have a good day** (Hav en god dag) - "hav uh gud dei"
- **You'll do great** (Du vil klare det fantastisk) - "juul duu greit"
- **I'm proud of you** (Jeg er stolt af dig) - "aim praud ov juu"
- **Good luck today** (Held og lykke i dag) - "gud lak tuh-dei"

## I L√∏bet af Dagen

<VocabCard
  word="Thinking of you"
  translation="Jeg t√¶nker p√• dig"
  pronunciation="thing-king ov juu"
  example="Just thinking of you."
/>

| Polsk | Dansk | Hvorn√•r |
|---------|-------|---------|
| **Thinking of you** | Jeg t√¶nker p√• dig | Midt p√• dagen |
| **I miss you** | Jeg savner dig | N√•r adskilt |
| **How's your day going?** | Hvordan g√•r din dag? | Eftermiddag |
| **See you soon** | Vi ses snart | F√∏r genforening |

## Godaften Fraser

- **Good evening** (Godaften) - "gud iiv-ning"
- **Finally home** (Endelig hjemme) - "fai-na-li houm"
- **I missed you** (Jeg har savnet dig) - "ai mist juu"
- **How was your day?** (Hvordan var din dag?) - "hau woz joor dei?"

## Godnat Fraser

<VocabCard
  word="Good night"
  translation="Godnat"
  pronunciation="gud nait"
  example="Good night, sleep tight."
/>

| Polsk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **Good night** | Godnat | gud nait |
| **Good night, my love** | Godnat, min elskede | gud nait mai lav |
| **Sweet dreams** | S√∏de dr√∏mme | swiit driimz |
| **Sleep tight** | Sov godt | sliip tait |
| **See you tomorrow** | Vi ses i morgen | sii juu tuh-mo-rou |

### Romantiske Godnat-beskeder

- **You're my last thought** (Du er min sidste tanke) - "joor mai last thot"
- **Dream of me** (Dr√∏m om mig) - "driim ov mi"
- **A goodnight kiss** (Et godnat-kys) - "uh gud-nait kis"
- **I love you, goodnight** (Jeg elsker dig, godnat) - "ai lav juu gud-nait"

<CultureTip flag="üáµüá±" title="Godnat-traditioner">
Et godnat-kys og 'I love you' er den perfekte afslutning p√• dagen.
</CultureTip>

## S√∏vnrelaterede Fraser

| Polsk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **I'm tired** | Jeg er tr√¶t | aim tai-urd |
| **I'm sleepy** | Jeg er s√∏vnig | aim slii-pi |
| **I can't sleep** | Jeg kan ikke sove | ai kant sliip |
| **I had a nightmare** | Jeg havde mareridt | ai had uh nait-mehr |
| **Let's take a nap** | Lad os tage en lur | lets teik uh nap |

## Weekend Morgen

- **Let's stay in bed** (Lad os blive i sengen) - "lets stei in bed"
- **A lazy morning** (En doven morgen) - "uh lei-zi mor-ning"
- **Shall we brunch?** (Skal vi brunche?) - "shal wii brunch?"
- **Come cuddle** (Kom og kram) - "kum ku-dul"

## Tekstbeskeder

### Morgenbeskeder
- **Good morning, sweetheart üíï** (Godmorgen, skat üíï)
- **Hope you have an amazing day** (H√•ber du har en fantastisk dag)
- **Thinking of you** (T√¶nker p√• dig)

### Aftenbeskeder
- **Looking forward to seeing you** (Gl√¶der mig til at se dig)
- **Almost home** (Snart hjemme)
- **Goodnight, sweet dreams üåô** (Godnat, dr√∏m s√∏dt üåô)

## Tips til Daglige Ritualer

1. **V√¶r konsekvent** - G√∏r det til en vane
2. **Varier fraserne** - Brug forskellige hver dag
3. **Tilf√∏j k√¶lenavne** - Det g√∏r det personligt
4. **Send beskeder** - N√•r I er adskilt
5. **V√¶r oprigtig** - Sig det med f√∏lelse

For flere romantiske fraser, se [polske romantiske fraser](/learn/da/pl/polish-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion/).

Disse daglige polske ritualer er sm√• k√¶rlighedserkl√¶ringer.

articles.content:
I rysk kultur √§r familjen central. Visa respekt och g√§stfrihet kommer att m√∂tas med v√§rme.

## F√∂rsta m√∂tet

### "–û—á–µ–Ω—å —Ä–∞–¥/—Ä–∞–¥–∞ –Ω–∞–∫–æ–Ω–µ—Ü —Å –≤–∞–º–∏ –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏—Ç—å—Å—è" (Ochen' rad/rada nakonets s vami poznakomit'sya)

### "–Ø –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ –≤–∞—Å —Å–ª—ã—à–∞–ª/—Å–ª—ã—à–∞–ª–∞" (Ya mnogo o vas slyshal/slyshala)

### "–ë–æ–ª—å—à–æ–µ —Å–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ, —á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–∏–≥–ª–∞—Å–∏–ª–∏ –º–µ–Ω—è" (Bol'shoye spasibo, chto priglasili menya)

## Artiga fraser

### "–ü–æ–∂–∞–ª—É–π—Å—Ç–∞, –∑–æ–≤–∏—Ç–µ –º–µ–Ω—è [namn]" (Pozhaluysta, zovite menya [namn])

### "–£ –≤–∞—Å –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω—ã–π –¥–æ–º" (U vas prekrasnyy dom)

### "–ú–æ–≥—É –ª–∏ —è —á–µ–º-—Ç–æ –ø–æ–º–æ—á—å?" (Mogu li ya chem-to pomoch'?)
**Betydelse:** Kan jag hj√§lpa till med n√•got?

### "–ï–¥–∞ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –≤–∫—É—Å–Ω–∞—è" (Yeda ochen' vkusnaya)
**Betydelse:** Maten √§r v√§ldigt god

## Om din relation

### "–í–∞—à —Å—ã–Ω/–í–∞—à–∞ –¥–æ—á—å –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –¥–ª—è –º–µ–Ω—è –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç"

### "–ú–Ω–µ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø–æ–≤–µ–∑–ª–æ, —á—Ç–æ —è –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç–∏–ª/–≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç–∏–ª–∞ [namn]"
**Betydelse:** Jag har tur som tr√§ffat [namn]

### "–ú—ã –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Å—á–∞—Å—Ç–ª–∏–≤—ã –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ" (My ochen' schastlivy vmeste)

## Visa intresse

### "–†–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂–∏—Ç–µ, –ø–æ–∂–∞–ª—É–π—Å—Ç–∞, –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –æ [√§mne]"

### "–ö–∞–∫ –≤—ã –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏–ª–∏—Å—å?" (Kak vy poznakomilis'?)
**Betydelse:** Hur tr√§ffades ni?

## Avskedsfraser

### "–°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ –∑–∞ —á—É–¥–µ—Å–Ω—ã–π –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä" (Spasibo za chudesnyy vecher)
**Betydelse:** Tack f√∂r den underbara kv√§llen

### "–ë—ã–ª–æ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–æ –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏—Ç—å—Å—è" (Bylo ochen' priyatno poznakomit'sya)
**Betydelse:** Det var v√§ldigt trevligt att tr√§ffas

## Kulturella tips

**Blommor:** Udda antal (j√§mna f√∂r begravningar).

**Skor:** Ta av skorna inomhus.

**Mat:** F√∂rv√§nta dig gener√∂s g√§stfrihet ‚Äì tacka nej √§r sv√•rt.

## Avslutande tankar
